title: Business & Finance
text:
The Fed kept its easy-money policies in place and vowed to maintain them until the U.S. economy recovers further, while highlighting an improved outlook.

--

The Dow closed above 33000 for the first time, rising 0.6% to 33015.37. The S&P 500 gained 0.3% to a record and the Nasdaq added 0.4%.

---

The FAA has stripped Boeing 's authority to inspect and sign off on several newly produced 787 Dreamliners.

---

U.S. antitrust officials are unlikely to mount a Supreme Court appeal seeking to revive the Qualcomm case, people familiar with the matter say.

---

Amazon said it is expanding its telehealth service nationwide this summer and opening the service to other companies.

---

II-VI submitted a new takeover offer for Coherent valued at roughly $7 billion, stoking a bidding war for the firm.

---

A French regulator rejected a plea from ad firms and publishers to block Apple's plan to curb tracking of individuals' mobile-app usage.

---

An Italian court acquitted Shell and Eni, along with the latter's chief, of bribery in connection with oil-drilling rights in Nigeria.

---

Lordstown Motors' CEO said the company is cooperating with an information request from the SEC.
